page.title: 13Visiting the handicapped
page.content: Lancaster Court is a home for handicapped children. It was opened in l976. The Spastics Society and Manchester Council built it jointly. It is now one of three homes for severely handicapped children run by the Manchester Social Services Department. Gary Jackson was the first officer-in-charge but he died in 1982 and they named the playroom after him. There were some severely handicapped children who could not walk. There are five houseparents in each bungalow. Pictures hang on the wall and there was a television in every living-room and a stereo with a radio. Nick is ten years old. He is improving. He can walk and speak! Ian is twelve years old and snores. He looks like a five year old. Soon they are all going to Blackpool for a four day holiday.
